You are overwhelmed by intense rapture and euphoria. Typically felt during peak life achievements or profound spiritual moments, this energy makes you feel invincible and infinitely connected to everything around you.

Ride this magnificent wave of positivity! Capture this feeling in a creative outlet or share it with others. However, stay grounded to ensure you don\'t make impulsive decisions in this heightened state.
You feel a warm sense of happiness and delight. Your heart feels light, and a natural smile brightens your face. This is the sweet spot of emotional well-being where you find pleasure in daily life.
Your positive energy is contagious and strengthens your resilience. Nurture this feeling by doing something you love or spending time with people who uplift you. Let this joy fuel your day.
You are in a state of calm peacefulness, like a gentle breeze or a quiet lake. You feel relaxed, content, and free from worry. It is a subtle but deeply restorative form of happiness.
This is the perfect time for restoration. Deepen this tranquility through meditation, reading, or a quiet walk. Cherish this stillness; it builds the inner strength you\'ll need for busier times.
You feel deep respect and awe towards someone else\'s skills, character, or achievements. It is a powerful form of trust that inspires you to look up to them and perhaps emulate their virtues.
Let this inspiration drive your own growth. Instead of just watching from afar, ask yourself what specific qualities you admire and how you can cultivate them in your own life.
You feel a strong sense of safety and confidence in someone or something. You are open, willing to rely on others, and free from suspicion. It is the solid foundation of all healthy relationships.
Trust is a precious gift. Strengthen your bonds by verbalizing your appreciation. At the same time, trust yourselfâ€”your judgment is sound, and you are supported by those around you.
You deeply acknowledge the reality of a situation without resistance or judgment. Even if things aren\'t perfect, you are at peace with them, understanding that they are part of a larger process.
Acceptance frees up energy that was wasted on fighting reality. Use this newfound freedom to move forward constructively. You have cleared the path for genuine change to happen.
You are gripped by an intense, overwhelming fear that freezes you in place or urges you to flee immediately. It is a primal reaction to a perceived severe threat to your physical or emotional safety.
Your safety is the only priority right now. Remove yourself from the situation if possible. Ground yourself by focusing on your breathing. Remind yourself: \'I am safe in this moment.\'

You feel uneasy and threatened by a specific danger or uncertainty. Your senses are heightened, and you are on guard. It is your mind\'s way of telling you that something needs your attention difficulty.
Fear is a messenger, not a master. Identify exactly what you are afraid of. Breaking it down into smaller, manageable risks often reveals that the shadow is bigger than the object casting it.
You feel a vague sense of unease or worry about the future. It\'s not a sharp panic, but a lingering shadow of \'what if\' that keeps you from fully relaxing in the present moment.
Uncertainty is natural, but don\'t let it paralyze you. Focus on what you can control right now. Taking even one small action can dispel the fog of worry and restore your sense of agency.
You are stunned by something vast or unexpected that defies your current understanding. It leaves you wide-eyed and perhaps speechless, challenging your previous worldview.
Embrace this moment of wonder. Allow it to expand your mind. Itâ€™s okay not to have immediate answers; just observing and experiencing this awe is a powerful catalyst for new ideas.
You are startled by a sudden, unexpected event. Your attention is instantly shifted, preparing you to process new information. It breaks your routine and wakes up your brain.
Viewing this interruption as a fresh opportunity rather than a nuisance can change everything. Take a breath, assess the new situation, and pivot with flexibility. Life is full of twists.
Your focus is scattered, pulled in many directions by minor surprises or noises. You feel unable to concentrate on a single task, and your thoughts are drifting aimlessly.
Multitasking is likely fueling this state. Stop everything. Take a five-minute break away from screens. Return to one single, simple task to rebuild your focus momentum gradually.
You are experiencing deep, crushing sorrow, often due to a significant loss. It feels like a heavy weight in your chest, and the world may seem gray and empty. This is a profound, necessary pain.
Grief demands to be felt. Do not rush your healing or suppress your tears. Surround yourself with supportive people, and treat yourself with extreme gentleness. Time will help carry this burden.
You feel downhearted and low in spirits. Your energy is depleted, and you may want to withdraw from the world. It is a natural response to disappointment or hurt.
It is okay not to be okay. Give yourself permission to rest and recharge. A warm bath, comfort food, or a good sleep can be surprisingly healing. Be your own best friend today.
You are in a reflective, slightly melancholic mood. You are deep in thought, perhaps dwelling on the past or complex ideas. It is a quiet, solitary state, not necessarily painful but serious.

Use this introspective mood productively. Journaling your thoughts can help you gain valuable insights. Just be careful not to get stuck in a loop of rumination; ensure you reconnect with the present.
You feel an intense, visceral revulsion. You want to completely reject or destroy the source of this feeling. It is a powerful defensive reaction to something you find deeply toxic.
This intense reaction signals a violation of your core values. Remove yourself physically and mentally from the toxic source. focusing on what you love and value will help cleanse your mind.
You feel repulsed or offended by something unpleasant. You want to distance yourself from it. It could be physical bad taste or moral disapproval of someone\'s actions.
Honor your boundaries. If something feels wrong, you have the right to walk away. Cleanse your environment or engage in something beautiful to counteract this negativity.
You feel weary and restless due to a lack of interest or stimulation. Time seems to drag, and nothing feels engaging. It is a sign that your mind is craving a new challenge.
Boredom is the birthplace of creativity. Instead of passive scrolling, try something completely newâ€”a new route, a new hobby, or a new book. Your brain is asking for fresh input.
You are consumed by a fiery, explosive anger that feels uncontrollable. Your body is tense, and you may have an urge to lash out physically or verbally. It is a high-energy state of defense.
Stop. Do not act on this impulse. Walk away immediately to protect yourself and others. Use high-intensity exercise or screaming into a pillow to release this physical energy safely.
You feel mad, frustrated, or antagonistic. You perceive an injustice or an obstacle blocking your way. It is a mobilizing energy designed to help you stand up for yourself.
Use this energy to solve the problem, not to create new ones. clearly communicate your boundaries without attacking. \'I feel\' statements are powerful tools here. Constructive action is the key.
You feel irritated or bothered by something mild. Itâ€™s like a pebble in your shoeâ€”not debilitating, but persistent and distracting. Your patience is wearing thin.
Check your stress levels; you might be running on empty. Take a deep breath and ask yourself: \'Will this matter in an hour?\' humor is often the best antidote to annoyance.
You are hyper-alert, scanning for potential threats or issues. You feel wired and ready to spring into action. It is a high-stakes state of focus, often driven by a need for control.
Your dedication is admirable, but constant vigilance leads to burnout. trust your preparations and allow yourself to exhale. The world won\'t fall apart if you close your eyes for a moment.
You are looking forward to something with eagerness. You are mentally rehearsing future events and feeling excitement. It is a forward-looking energy that drives planning.
Savor the journey, not just the destination. Use this excitement to fuel your preparation. visualizing success is powerful, but remember to enjoy the steps you are taking right now.
You are curious and engaged. Your attention is captured by something fascinating, and you want to explore it further. It is the spark of learning and discovery.
Follow this thread of curiosity! It often leads to new passions or solutions. Dive deep, ask questions, and let yourself get absorbed. This is how you grow and find inspiration.

An exquisite blend of Joy and Trust. You feel a deep, warm affection and a profound connection. It makes the world seem brighter and fosters a desire to nurture and being close to the object of your affection.
Celebrate this beautiful feeling. Express your heart openly through words, acts of service, or quality time. Love grows when shared, and it becomes a sanctuary for both you and the receiver.
A mix of Trust and Fear. You are yielding to a higher authority or an unavoidable situation. It is not necessarily weakness; it can be a conscious choice to align with a greater force or destiny.

Submission can be an act of wisdom when fighting is futile. However, ensure you do not lose your voice completely. Surrender to the flow, but keep your inner compass active to protect your core values.
The intersection of Fear and Surprise. You are struck by something vast, magnificent, or divine that transcends your understanding. You feel small yet connected to something infinite.
Let this feeling expand your perspective. Whether it is nature, art, or a great idea, allow it to humble and inspire you. Awe shifts the focus from the self to the wonder of existence.

Surprise meets Sadness. You are faced with an unexpected disappointment or a reality that falls short of your standards. It involves a rejection of the current situation and a feeling of being let down.
Disapproval often mirrors your own high standards. Before judging too harshly, try to understand the context. Communicate your expectations clearly instead of just silently rejecting the outcome.
A heavy blend of Sadness and Disgust. You feel deep regret and self-reproach over a past action. It is a painful realization that you have violated your own moral code or hurt someone.

Guilt is useful only if it leads to repair. Acknowledge your mistake, make amends if possible, and then forgive yourself. Dwelling in self-punishment prevents you from moving forward and doing better.
Disgust combined with Anger. You feel a strong sense of superiority and loathing towards someone or something. It creates a psychological distance and a feeling that the object is beneath you.
Contempt is toxic to any relationship and to your own soul. It hardens your heart. Challenge this feeling by trying to find one redeeming quality or the human story behind the object of your scorn.
Anger fuels Anticipation. You are driven to push forward, dominate, or overcome obstacles forcefully. It is a high-octane state of challenge where you are ready to break through barriers.

This energy is powerful fuelâ€”use it to conquer tasks, not people. Direct this force into achieving a difficult goal or advocating for a cause, but be careful not to bulldoze over others in the process.
Anticipation brightened by Joy. You have a sunny outlook and a firm belief that things will turn out well. You see opportunities where others see problems and feel energized about the future.
Your positivity is a magnet for success. Keep visualizing your best outcomes, but stay flexible. Optimism combined with action is an unstoppable force that can inspire everyone around you.
Joy is tainted by Fear. You might be enjoying something but feel uneasy, wondering if you are allowed to, or worrying about consequences. It is a conflict between pleasure and conscience.
examine the source of this guilt. Are you actually harming anyone, or is it an internalized rule? If you have done no harm, give yourself full permission to enjoy this moment. You deserve happiness.
Trust mixes with Surprise. You are open to the new and unexpected, eager to explore and learn. It is a state of wondrous inquiry where the unknown feels inviting rather than scary.

Feed this hunger for knowledge! Ask \'why\' and \'how.\' Dive down the rabbit hole of a new topic. Curiosity keeps your brain young and your life interesting. Follow where your interest leads you today.
Fear and Sadness merge into a dark void. You feel trapped, seeing no way out and believing that hope is lost. It is a suffocating sense of doom and helpless resignation.
When you are in a dark tunnel, keep walking. You don\'t need to see the exit yet; just take one tiny step. Reach out to someoneâ€”connection is the lifeline that can pull you out of this abyss.
Surprise collides with Disgust. You are shocked by something repulsive or unacceptable and struggle to accept it as reality. It is a strong recoil from a truth you wish were false.

It takes time to process a shocking truth. Don\'t force yourself to accept it immediately. Allow yourself to feel the revolt, then slowly begin to integrate this new reality so you can respond effectively.

Sadness fueled by Anger. You feel pain at another\'s fortune and a burning resentment that you lack it. It is a corrosive feeling of \'why them and not me?\' that highlights your own perceived deficits.
Turn envy into a roadmap. It shows you exactly what you want for yourself. Instead of resenting their success, use it as proof that it\'s possible. Ask, \'How can I build that for myself?\'
Disgust meets Anticipation. You expect the worst from people or the world, guarding yourself with scorn. You believe you know the \'ugly truth\' and refuse to get your hopes up.
Cynicism protects you from disappointment but locks out joy. Try a small experiment: trust someone or something just a little bit today. The world might surprise you with its kindness if you let it.
Anger provides the energy for Joy in one\'s own self. You feel a robust sense of worth and satisfaction in your achievements. It is a self-affirming stance that says, \'I matter, and I did well.\'
Stand tall and own your success. You worked hard for this. Sharing your journey with humility can inspire others. Celebrating yourself gives you the strength to lift others up as well.
Anticipation meets Trust in a surrender to destiny. You believe the future is set and accept whatever comes. It can be a peaceful surrender or a passive resignation to the inevitable.
Accepting what you cannot change brings peace, but don\'t forget your own agency. You are the co-author of your life. Trust the flow, but keep steering your boat with intention.
Joy meets Surprise. You are bubbling over with happiness from an unexpected turn of events. It is a fresh, spontaneous joy that lifts your spirits like a sudden burst of fireworks.
Ride this wave of spontaneity! Share your good news or simpler pleasures. Moments like these are the sweeteners of life; don\'t overanalyze them, just let yourself smile.

Trust and Sadness blend into a poignant nostalgia. You feel a safe, tender connection to the past, missing something dear yet feeling grateful for the memory. It is a soft, bittersweet backward glance.
It is lovely to visit the past, but don\'t live there. Use these warm memories to fuel your present. Reconnect with an old friend or look at old photos, then gently return to today.
Fear combined with Disgust creates a painful sense of unworthiness. You feel you have failed fundamentally and want to hide from judgment. It is an isolating feeling that attacks your self-esteem.
Shame survives in secrets. Break its power by sharing your feelings with someone safe. Remember: making a mistake does not mean **you** are a mistake. You are worthy of belonging and love.
Surprise mixed with Anger. You are shocked by a violation of fairness or decency. It is a sudden, explosive reaction to an injustice that you did not see coming. You feel compelled to object.
Your moral compass is working. However, explosive reaction can backfire. Take a moment to cool the heat so you can articulate your objection clearly and effectively.
Sadness tinges Anticipation. You expect the future to be bleak. It is a defensive strategy to avoid disappointment by assuming failure in advance. You view hope as a dangerous risk.
Assuming the worst feels safe, but it limits your potential. Try asking, \'What if it goes right?\' Just opening that door a crack can let in enough light to change your trajectory.

Disgust mixed with Joy. You feel a strange, dark fascination with things usually considered grim or repelling. It is the curiosity about the macabre, laughing at the grotesque, or finding beauty in decay.

Exploring the shadow side of life can be a way to process fears. Ensure this fascination isn\'t desensitizing you to real suffering. Use it to deepen your understanding of the human condition\'s full spectrum.
Anger meets Trust. You feel entitled to take charge, confident in your power. It is an assertive, commanding state where you expect others to follow your lead without question.
Confidence is great, but check your impact. Are you leading or bulldozing? True strength empowers others. Try stepping back and listening; you might find that collaboration yields better results.
Anticipation tainted by Fear. You are worried about what is coming next. Your mind is racing with potential threats, and you feel unable to settle. It is the buzzing tension of the unknown.

Ground yourself. Your mind is living in a scary future that hasn\'t happened. Bring your focus to your feet on the floor, your breath, the sounds in this room. Handle this moment; the future can wait.
Joy and Sadness dance together. You feel the beauty of a moment because you know it is ending. It is the poignant feeling of a happy farewell or a touching memory.
This complex emotion deepens your soul. It teaches you to cherish the fleeting nature of life. Cry and smile at the same time; it is a sign of a heart fully alive.

Trust fights with Disgust. You are torn. You want to approach and accept, but something feels deeply wrong. It is the confusion of loving the sinner but hating the sin, or wanting a goal but hating the path.
Don\'t force a resolution yet. Siting with the tension is uncomfortable but necessary. Explore both sides of the conflict without judgment. Clarity often emerges from simply waiting and observing.
Fear locks horns with Anger. You are terrified yet furious, trapped in a high-tension paralysis. You want to fight and run at the same time, resulting in being unable to move.
This is a state of extreme stress. You need to discharge this energy gently. Shake your hands, move your body, or make a sound. Any small movement can break the paralysis.
Surprise blends with Anticipation. You are facing the unknown and have no idea what to expect. It is the disorientation of a plot twist where the old map no longer matches the territory.
Confusion is the precursor to learning. It means your brain is rearranging itself. Be patient. You don\'t need to know the way forward instantly. Just observe the new landscape.

Love (Joy+Trust) twists into a desperate need to control. Fueled by a hidden fear of loss, you cling tightly to the object of your affection, stifling them in an attempt to ensure they never leave you.
True love thrives in freedom, not cages. Your tight grip pushes away what you most want to keep. Practice trusting the bond enough to let go. Open hands hold more than clenched fists.
Submission (Trust+Fear) degrades into self-abasement. You bow down not out of respect, but out of a terrified need to please. You suppress your own dignity to avoid conflict or rejection.
Respecting others should not mean erasing yourself. Your voice and needs matter just as much as anyone else\'s. Stand up straight; you can be cooperative without being a doormat.
Awe (Fear+Surprise) shifts into immediate danger signal. It is the sharp, sudden jolt of adrenaline when a threat appears. Your senses are razor-sharp, and your body is primed for fight or flight.
Your survival instinct is screaming. Pause for a split second to assess: is this a real tiger or a paper tiger? Respond to reality, not just the noise of your alarm bells.
Disapproval (Surprise+Sadness) hits with blunt force. You are stunned by a traumatic or deeply upsetting event. It feels like a physical blow that leaves you numb, unable to process the grief yet.
Treat yourself like a patient in recovery. Do not force normal functioning. Wrap yourself in warmth and safety. Your mind needs time to wire around this new, painful gap in your reality.
Remorse (Sadness+Disgust) turns inward as toxic shame. You view yourself with the same revulsion you would have for a monster. It is a paralyzing hatred of your own existence.
This voice in your head is a liar. No human is defined solely by their worst moments. Separate your actions from your soul. Extend the same compassion to yourself that you would to a wounded animal.
Contempt (Disgust+Anger) mixed with jealousy. You despise someone because they have what you want. You tear them down to avoid feeling the pain of your own lack. It is a bitter, sneering state.
tearing others down won\'t build you up. This bitterness is drinking poison and expecting the other person to die. Focus on your own path; their success does not rob you of yours.
Aggressiveness (Anger+Anticipation) hardens into a cold plot for payback. You are obsessed with balancing the scales, believing that hurting them will heal you. It is a focused, destructive drive.
Revenge creates a cycle that never ends. The best revenge is living a beautiful, unbothered life. Don\'t let your enemy rent space in your head rent-free. Evict them and reclaim your peace.

Optimism (Anticipation+Joy) lacks wisdom. You trust blindly, ignoring red flags. You see the world through rose-colored glasses that obscure cliff edges. It is an innocent but dangerous vulnerability.
Keep your soft heart, but sharpen your eyes. Trust needs to be earned, not given away freely. A little skepticism is not cynicism; it is the armor that protects your beautiful hope.
Guilt (Joy+Fear) makes you reject your own needs. You feel selfish for existing or wanting things. You starve your soul to feel \'good\' or \'safe\' from judgment.
You are not a vessel just for others. You have a right to take up space, to eat, to laugh, to want. Nourishing yourself gives you more to give. it is not a sin to be human.

Curiosity (Trust+Surprise) is checked by hesitation. You want to look, but you are afraid of what you might find. You stand on the threshold, oscillating between the safety of the known and the pull of the unknown.
Dip a toe in. You don\'t have to dive. Investigation doesn\'t mean commitment. Satisfy your curiosity in small, safe ways. Knowledge is better than the anxiety of \'what if\'.
Despair (Fear+Sadness) solidifies into a belief that you are powerless. You feel like a victim of circumstance, waiting for a rescue that may not come. It is the heavy inertia of \'why bother\'.
Learned helplessness is a cage with an unlocked door. Push the door. Do one tiny thingâ€”wash a dish, make a bed. Prove to your brain that your actions still have an effect on the world.
Unbelief (Surprise+Disgust) becomes horror. You are recoiling from something so grotesque or morally repugnant that it shakes your faith in humanity. It is a deep, shuddering rejection.
Witnessing darkness can traumatize. Don\'t stare into the abyss too long. Counteract this horror by actively seeking out examples of goodness, beauty, and kindness. Rebalance your view of the world.
Envy (Sadness+Anger) festers over time. It is a cold, chronic anger at unfair treatment. You replay old hurts, nursing a grudge that hardens your heart like a stone.
A grudge is a heavy stone to carry in your pocket. It slows you down, not them. Forgiveness isn\'t saying what they did was okay; it\'s saying you are done carrying their baggage. Drop the stone.
Cynicism (Disgust+Anticipation) becomes a worldview. You assume everyone has an angle. You pride yourself on not being fooled, but you are lonely behind your walls.
Walls keep enemies out, but they also keep friends out. Try looking for evidence of sincerity. Being occasionally fooled is the price of admission for human connectionâ€”and it\'s worth paying.
Pride (Anger+Joy) inflates into arrogance. You feel superior, invincible, and deaf to criticism. You believe you can do no wrong, which is usually when the fall begins.
Gravitate towards people who tell you the truth, not just what you want to hear. Acknowledge luck and the help of others in your success. Humility doesn\'t maximize you; it grounds you in reality.
Fatalism (Anticipation+Trust) finds a light. You accept the uncertainty of the future but choose to believe in a positive outcome. It is a fragile but resilient flame in the dark.
Protect this flame. Hope is a discipline, not just a feeling. When the winds blow, cup your hands around it. Your belief is the first step in making the impossible possible.
Delight (Joy+Surprise) is muddled. You are happy but don\'t understand why, or the situation is chaotic. It is a giddy, disoriented happiness.
Don\'t overthink it. Joy doesn\'t always need a thesis statement. precise understanding can come later; for now, just let the bubbles of happiness fizz. Enjoy the mystery.
Sentimentality (Trust+Sadness) turns selfish using pain. You soothe yourself by dwelling on how hard you have it. It feels warm like a blanket, but it suffocates your agency.
It\'s okay to comfort yourself, but don\'t get addicted to the victim role. You are the hero of your story, not just the tragedy. What is the next plot twist you can write for yourself?
Shame (Fear+Disgust) goes public. You feel exposed, ridiculed, and small. It is the burning face and the wish to disappear into the floor.
This moment does not define you. Hold your head up; your worth is internal.
Outrage (Surprise+Anger) spins you around. You are so shocked by an offense that you can\'t think straight. You are flailing mentally.
Stop flailing. Find a fixed pointâ€”a fact, a value, a trusted friend. Anchor yourself there until the world stops spinning. Then you can act with precision instead of chaos.
Pessimism (Sadness+Anticipation) gives up. You bow your head to a bleak fate. It is the sigh of \'what\'s the use?\' escaping your lips.
Rest if you must, but don\'t call it the end. Even in a desert, flowers bloom after rain. Stay open to the possibility that you might be wrong about the future. Surprise is always possible.
Morbidness (Disgust+Joy) becomes mean-spirited mockery. You laugh at things that should be pitied or respected. It is a cruel way to distance yourself from vulnerability.
Cruelty is the weak man\'s strength. Ask yourself what pain you are avoiding by laughing at this. Kindness requires real courage. Dare to be kind instead of clever.
Dominance (Anger+Trust) loses compassion. You rule with an iron fist, crushing dissent. You mistake fear for respect.
A king without love is just a tyrant. People follow you because they have to, not because they want to. Soften your grip. True power lifts others up; it doesn\'t hold them down.
Anxiety (Anticipation+Fear) darkens into heavy foreboding. You feel a cold weight, certain that doom is approaching. It is a haunting, silent terror.
Dread lives in the shadows. Shine a light on it. Name the monster exactly. Often, the vague shape in the corner is just a pile of laundry. Reality is rarely as scary as your imagination.
Bittersweetness (Joy+Sadness) looks backward. You ache for a time that is gone. It is a beautiful pain that honors what was lost.
Visit the past to retrieve strength, not to mourn. The love you felt then is still yours now. Carry it forward into your future, creating new memories worthy of nostalgia.
Ambivalence (Trust+Disgust) leans towards suspicion. You want to connect, but your gut says \'unsafe\'. You are wary and guarded.
Your intuition is a valuable guard dog. Listen to it. If trust hasn\'t been earned, don\'t give it. Wait for consistent actions to bridge the gap before you lower the drawbridge.

A model proposed by Robert Plutchik. Colors unfolding like petals represent 8 basic emotions, and adjacent emotions mix to form complex emotions.
Joy, Trust, Fear, Surprise, Sadness, Disgust, Anger, Anticipation. Opposite emotions have opposing properties.
Emotions formed by combining two basic emotions.\nFor example, Joy + Trust = Love.
The same Joy can be divided into Serenity (Weak) â†’ Joy (Medium) â†’ Ecstasy (Strong) depending on intensity.
